author: paulhauner
content:
At Lighthouse, we've just merged our `kintsugi` branch into `unstable` (that's our pre-release branch)  ðŸŽ‰ 

This means everyone should start targeting the `unstable` branch and the `sigp/lighthouse:unstable` docker image. We'll support the old tags for a short time, but we want to try and avoid supporting it long-term.

author: yperbasis
content: <@!360491619402776577> Could you please mark Erigon as M0 for Kintsugi? Our tracking issue: https://github.com/ledgerwatch/erigon/issues/3078

author: mariusvanderwijden
content: You should be able to modify the kintsugi tracker yourself, if not I can also put it in

author: pawandhananjay
content:
another clarification w.r.t the strictly increasing json rpc ids. The spec says
> Execution Layer client software MUST NOT process `engine_forkchoiceUpdated` method call if its JSON-RPC request ID is lower than the ID assigned to the previous call of this method.
In case this happens, is the EL expected to return a specific json rpc error code? -32600(`Invalid Request`)  seems the most appropriate error for this case but just wanted to check the expected behaviour for our mock tests
